chapters.key_content: Hypertension affects approximately 45% of adults and is defined as systolic BP ≥130 mmHg or diastolic BP ≥80 mmHg. Primary hypertension accounts for 90-95% of cases. Treatment includes lifestyle modifications and pharmacotherapy with ACE inhibitors, ARBs, calcium channel blockers, or thiazide diuretics as first-line agents.
important_concepts: White coat hypertension vs sustained hypertension
chapters.diagnostic_workup: Initial evaluation should include CBC, comprehensive metabolic panel, lipid profile, urinalysis, ECG, and assessment of cardiovascular risk factors

chapters.key_content: Diabetes mellitus is characterized by hyperglycemia due to defects in insulin secretion, insulin action, or both. Type 1 diabetes results from autoimmune destruction of pancreatic beta cells, while type 2 diabetes involves insulin resistance and relative insulin deficiency. Complications include retinopathy, nephropathy, neuropathy, and accelerated cardiovascular disease.
important_concepts: Pathophysiology of type 1 vs type 2 diabetes
Insulin therapy and oral hypoglycemic agents
chapters.diagnostic_workup: Diagnosis confirmed by HbA1c ≥6.5%, fasting glucose ≥126 mg/dL, or 2-hour OGTT ≥200 mg/dL on two occasions

medical_textbooks.title: Robbins and Cotran Pathologic Basis of Disease

chapters.key_content: Cardiovascular disease remains the leading cause of death globally. Atherosclerosis is the underlying pathology in most cases, involving endothelial dysfunction, lipid accumulation, inflammation, and plaque formation. Acute coronary syndromes result from plaque rupture or erosion leading to thrombosis.
chapters.morphologic_features: Atherosclerotic plaques show fibrous caps, lipid cores, inflammatory infiltrates, and potential calcification or ulceration

chapters.key_content: Endocrine disorders result from hormone excess, deficiency, or resistance. Diabetes mellitus involves beta cell destruction (type 1) or insulin resistance with beta cell dysfunction (type 2). Complications arise from chronic hyperglycemia causing advanced glycation end products and oxidative stress.
important_concepts: Beta cell pathology in diabetes types
chapters.morphologic_features: Diabetic nephropathy shows glomerular basement membrane thickening, mesangial expansion, and nodular glomerulosclerosis
